question: 5 (a)
sols_html:
To compute the ciphertext given the plain text, one must compute

\(\displaystyle P^{e} \mod{n}\)

and in this case, we have

\(\displaystyle 101^{1189} \equiv 35 \mod{1271}\)

so the value of the ciphertext is \(\displaystyle C = 35\). Note: You do not need to actually perform the above computation. It is given to us.
sols_latex:
To compute the ciphertext given the plain text, one must compute

$\displaystyle P^{e} \mod{n}$

and in this case, we have

$\displaystyle 101^{1189} \equiv 35 \mod{1271}$

so the value of the ciphertext is $\displaystyle C = 35$. Note: You do
not need to actually perform the above computation. It is given to us.
sols_raw:
To compute the ciphertext given the plain text, one must compute

<math> \displaystyle P^{e} \mod{n}</math>

and in this case, we have 

<math> \displaystyle 101^{1189} \equiv 35 \mod{1271}</math>

so the value of the ciphertext is <math> \displaystyle C = 35</math>. Note: You do not need to actually perform the above computation. It is given to us.
statement_html:
Alice wants Bob to send her a secret integer P between 0 and 1250 using RSA encryption with key \(\displaystyle (e, n) = (1189, 1271)\) (so the exponent is 1189 and the modulus is 1271, it is way too small to be really secure, but basic RSA encryption and decryption methods still work of course).

(a) Bob knows that (the plaintext) \(\displaystyle P = 101\), he computes the ciphertext \(\displaystyle C = 35\) and communicates this number to Alice. Explain how Bob computed C.
statement_latex:
Alice wants Bob to send her a secret integer \emph{P} between 0 and 1250
using RSA encryption with key $\displaystyle (e, n) = (1189, 1271)$ (so
the exponent is 1189 and the modulus is 1271, it is way too small to be
really secure, but basic RSA encryption and decryption methods still
work of course).

\textbf{(a)} Bob knows that (the plaintext) $\displaystyle P = 101$, he
computes the ciphertext $\displaystyle C = 35$ and communicates this
number to Alice. Explain how Bob computed \emph{C}.
statement_raw:
Alice wants Bob to send her a secret integer ''P'' between 0 and 1250 using RSA encryption with key <math> \displaystyle (e, n) = (1189, 1271)</math> (so the exponent is 1189 and the modulus is 1271, it is way too small to be really secure, but basic RSA encryption and decryption methods still work of course).

'''(a)''' Bob knows that (the plaintext) <math> \displaystyle P = 101 </math>, he computes the ciphertext <math> \displaystyle C = 35 </math> and communicates this number to Alice. Explain how Bob computed ''C''.
